citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
No species differences considerations were detailed in the avian environment enrichment plan. Rather, the plan listed
examples of enrichment items that birds broadly may be provided, but frequency, amount or specific types of enrichment
were not determined for the species on hand. Failure to determine minimum standards of environment enrichment by
species of birds prior to their use in research may result in development of adverse behavior or psychological stress in the
animal. Research facilities should consider species differences when determining the type or methods of enrichment.
Correct by 27 October 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.154(b) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
No species differences considerations were detailed in the avian environment enrichment plan. Rather, the plan listed 
examples of enrichment items that birds broadly may be provided, but frequency, amount or specific types of enrichment 
were not determined for the species on hand. Failure to determine minimum standards of environment enrichment by 
species of birds prior to their use in research may result in development of adverse behavior or psychological stress in the 
animal. Research facilities should consider species differences when determining the type or methods of enrichment.  
 
Correct by 27 October 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
